page.title: 17NEWCASTLE CENTRAL STATION
page.content: The Central Station was designed by {John Dobson}and opened in 1850 by Queen Victoria and Prince Albert. The{High Level Bridge}and the{King {Edward Bridge}bring trains over the River Tyne into the east and west ends of the station respectively while a new bridge has been built to connect the {Metro}system into the station. The station is part of British Rail's {Eastern Region}and on the main line between London and Edinburgh. The station is particularly busy on Fridays and Sundays and in the early morning and evening Monday to Friday. Some of the jobs created by the railway are drivers, guards, porters, signalmen, ticket clerks and cleaners. The station also has a{goods depot} and deals with livestock, chemicals, coal and motor cars.
